Also, not quite sure if 'paedophilia' is quite the right term for 'drugging and anally raping a 13-year old'. I mean, while there's clearly a lotta [ilove[/i] going on there...

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pseudochron, Zem, sncether)

name: i_love_kate
text: Are you at all concerned by the possibility that at one point fandom transitions into simply not having any imagination for original dialogue?

name: epicurus
text:
You don' know me, gringo .

Also, a little.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Treasure of the Sierra Madre?

name: dougthehead
text:
YES!!! Beef grew up in bad circumstances, he's been shot at least twice at this point, his girl leaves him, he's suffering from terrible depression, and there seems to be no end to his misery. Then he gets Weldon, who's such a cheerful and useful dog that he begins to regain a little bit of self-respect. And when Pat tries to beat that back down... Beef finally learns to stand up for himself. "You dis my dog, you fluff my hog." This is the turning point of Roast Beef's character. After this he may still get depressed, but he's no longer the guy who feels like going up to the moon and leaving it all behind. This strip is the very essence of redemption.

Second best part? Pat, shrinking down and taking it like the bully and coward he truly is.

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by JuanCarlos, Shabadoo, j_a_s_e)

name: srikamaraja
text:
Chubby for the ever-satisfying phenomena of Avatar/Comment synergy.

By which I mean I heard a heavily rolled 'r' when I read 'agreed'.

name: woodenteeth
text: The thing I like about Achewood is that there is PLENTY to think about. When there's a character change you better believe it happens for a reason. Even if some of the plot points fall by the way side...

name: deusoma
text: Absofreakinglutely.

name: drskradley
text: Excellent.  Truly, an important strip.  About fluffing hogs.

name: landowmpg
text: I enjoy the single, menacing paw he places on Pat's shoulder in the last pannel.  Beef is not fucking around.

name: nessotron
text: Angry Beef is the best kind of Beef.

name: a_dude
text: Pat is a dick.

name: twotonturkey
text: Obviously.  Only a dick would use a bulgur salad as a reward for anything.

name: slickshoes3234
text: a reward for reviewing HIS fuckin' tax return !

name: caseyb3
text:
Pat thinks with incentives, obviously. He's one of those rare birds that TOTALLY gets economics before he gets taught the theory behind it - that is, a Dick.

Special bonus: he made the salad for them as a reward. No sense letting Beef have all the salad; without Pat, after all, there'd be no tax return at all.

Extra super special bonus: Look at the look on Pat's face in the fourth panel. So smug. Jesus Christ.

name: achilleselbow
text: I was going to say that he can't be that much of a dick if he at least offered a reward (that is, if he were a real dick, he'd just demand that Beef do it for free). Then I looked up what Bulgur was and changed my mind. I would fill out a tax return to NOT have to eat a freaking Middle Eastern oat grain salad.

name: ford
text:
I just wanna toss this out:

Bulgur is some of the blandest, nastiest shit ever.

name: heccibiggs
text: A zealous bulgur fan lamed you.

text: Man, whatever happened to Weldon? I don't think we've seen him around lately.

text: YES! That is my favorite Calvin and Hobbes ever. I'm so glad someone else knows it!

name: soup_alex
text:
I read this strip when I was maybe ten years old, and almost immediately considered harassing my parents for a smock.
Also, who the fuck has lamed these comments; have you no soul?

name: nice-on-water
text: I wouldn't knock the smock of the artiste that produced Symphony in Orange #1.

name: zem
text: this phrase can still get me to burst into laughter

name: quantumcasaba
text: Pat often sounds like the Monarch in my head. All finicky and indignant. I can't decide if I like that or if it's appropriate, I just can't get the voice out of my head.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Hmm, yeah, I can hear that.  I think of it as a little less nasally and whiny than the Monarch, more prepared and authoritative, in a failing attempt to cover his anger issues.  Finicky and indignant, though, are right on the money.

name: spinynorman
text: Look at how mad-jutty the cats' chins get when they are ornery.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: Fine, then.
Lyle: grins from the cowgate
Onstad: Pork trend.

name: chachibenji
text: If anyone were to diss my dog I would in fact shake them violently and threaten them with forced cunnilingus.

name: atmus
text: Forced burritolingus would be harsher.

name: dominus101
text: Ummm...since your profile says you're a guy, forced cunnilingus would mean they wouldn't be fluffing your hog if they dissed your dog.

name: chachibenji
text: I imagine you would still be terrified and intimidated even if the inverse were true.

name: dominus101
text: True enough

name: heccibiggs
text:
Even though I've only read this strip once before, I'm very familiar with the phrase "You dis my dog you fluff my hog", because it's pretty popular all over the forums - and rightly so.

However, the text from panel seven is so face-meltingly fantastic , I sort of think panel five slightly pales in comparison.

name: ocarina654
text:
I laughed louder and longer to panel seven than to any other panel in any other comic ever.
Obvious statement is obvious, but I love how Achewood's humor isn't just a funny joke, its the characters, and if you don't know the characters its only half as funny.

name: unityrolf
text: Why is Pat doing his taxes in November? He seems like someone who would either do them the second his W-2s showed up or possibly never at all.

name: singtralala
text: there's absolutely no way to describe my laughter after the fluff my hog thing. flippin' priceless.

name: iguessso
text: pat hates having animals in his house, and yet he is vegan.

name: zapatos
text: Just because he's gay, doesn't mean he's open minded.

name: sp1derbaby
text: To me, the italics in the last panel suggest that Beef isn't shouting. He is speaking in a quiet, calm, measured voice but with an edge that Dennis Hopper would stew himself over.

name: dasilodavi
text: It took me a few reads, but now I know what truly pisses me off about this strip, and it's not just that Pat is a dick to Weldon.  It's that he's a dick to Weldon after he's brought Beef over to look over (read: DO) his taxes for him.  Fuck this guy!

text: That's exactly how I feel about my cats.

name: greenkoolayd

text: Does this strip remind anyone of the "mark it zero" rant from The Big Lebowski? If it weren't for Beef's weird monotone, that's how I'd picture him sounding.

name: lolsworth
text: You do not diss a man's dog. That is the action of a jerkwad.
